newsitem.title: CANADA: Embassy refers Bre-X matters to Jakarta.
newsitem.headline: Embassy refers Bre-X matters to Jakarta.

text.p: The Indonesian embassy in Ottawa defered all decisions on matters relating to Bre-X Minerals Ltd and its massive Busang gold find to Jakarta on Thursday.
"Frankly speaking, we're not directly involved in this matter," Chaidir Siregar, an official at the Indonesian embassy in Ottawa, said in a phone interview.

"What I've said is that, from the beginning, the Indonesian government has no preference" about who Bre-X should choose as a partner in the Busang deposit, Siregar said. "Bre-X has a big role in this development. The government just watches."
Bre-X is in the midst of finalizing a deal with Barrick Gold Corp after the Indonesian government asked the two companies to carve up Bre-X's stake in the gold find between them.
The government asked for a joint venture, with Barrick getting 75 percent, Bre-X getting 25 percent and the two parties considering giving the government a 10 percent stake.
Bre-X investors and Barrick's rival, Vancouver-based Placer Dome Inc cried foul about not having an open bidding process.
But earlier this week, Siregar gave Placer and Bre-X investors hope when he said the government was eager to have the site developed and was willing to consider other companies.
"Whoever has the capability to (develop the resource), they are welcome," he told the Toronto Globe and Mail. "It makes no difference to the government."
But on Thursday, he would not clarify whether the Indonesian government would be willing to consider an open bidding process.
"All we know is there are negotiations between Bre-X and Barrick," he said.
